title: Cell Lysis
description: Breaking open cells to release their contents
details: Using detergents and enzymes to disrupt cell membranes and nuclear envelopes, releasing DNA into solution.

title: Protein Removal
details: Adding salt solutions and proteases to denature and precipitate proteins, leaving DNA in solution.

title: DNA Precipitation
details: Using alcohol (ethanol or isopropanol) to precipitate DNA out of solution as white fibers.

title: DNA Washing
details: Washing DNA pellet with 70% ethanol to remove residual salts and impurities.

title: DNA Resuspension
details: Dissolving clean DNA in sterile water or TE buffer for downstream applications.
